chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert M Geiger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
$1500.00 cash bond applied. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no contact with JLC, her family or their residence. Must have no contact with any minor under the age of 18 unless in the presence of the parent or guardian.

Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Must undergo a sex offender evaluation and comply with any and all treatment. 
Must abide by lifetime sex offender registration.

Defendant Robert M Geiger in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Defendant Robert M Geiger in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:31  Court relates and gives appearances.
1:31  Atty. O'Boyle relates.
1:33  State relates and gives recommendation.

1:48  Robert Geiger makes statement.
1:48  Court relates.

Imposed  Wisconsin State Prison (Dodge is Reception Facility) 10 years and zero months as follows:  Initial confinement 5 years and zero months; extended supervision 5 years and zero months with credit for 113 days served.
Extended supervision:
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge
Lifetime sex offender registration
No contact with JLC; her family or their residences
No contact with any minor under age of 18 unless in presence  of parent or guardian.
Undergo sex offender evaluation and treatment and comply with any and all treatment.
Not eligible for boot camp or substance abuse program.
Dodge Correctional is reception center.
Firearms restriction given.
Order for DNA sample given to defendant.

Court accepts the jurors verdict. Court orders a PSI. Bond revoked. 
Sentencing hearing set for 6/25/15 at 1:30 PM

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert M Geiger in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:31 Mary Dexter, Barron County Sheriff's Department Detective, called, sworn and direct by State.  Witness identifies Defendant.
11:34 Cross by Attorney O'Boyle.
Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over.
State files Information.  Defense waives reading of Information and pleads not guilty.
Court will send notice of next hearing date.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must have no contact with J.L.C. DOB 09-13-2005.
Must have no unsupervised contact with female juveniles.
